Trial_Design.evidence: This multicentre trial randomized consecutive patients

Participants.evidence: patients undergoing surgery for pilonidal disease

Objective.evidence: The aim of this study was to compare wound healing with dialkylcarbamoyl chloride (DACC)‐coated dressings versus alginate dressings.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of wounds healed after 75 days.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 246 patients were included: 120 in the DACC‐coated group and 126 in the alginate group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In per‐protocol analysis, there were significantly more patients with completely healed wounds

Result_Outcome.evidence: 78 of 103 (75·7 per cent) versus 58 of 97 (60 per cent) respectively (odds ratio 2·55, 95 per cent c.i. 1·12 to 5·92; P = 0·023).
